means: 尊敬( esteem的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: He was esteemed by his neighbours.
The art of conversation is highly esteemed in France.
sentence.Network_cn: 在法国十分尊重谈话技巧.

sentence.Network_en: He esteemed that he understood what I had said.
sentence.Network_cn: 他认为已经听懂我说的意思了.

list.abs: ...and belongingness needs)、自尊需求(esteem needs)、自我实现需求(self-actualization needs)
（4）尊重的需要（esteem neeD）：指在生理、安全、归属和爱的需要得到基本满足后产生的对自己社会价值追求的需要。包括自尊 …
尊重需要（Esteem Need） ：包括内在的尊重如自尊心、自主权、 成就感的需要，以及外在的尊重如地位、认同、受重视等需要；求 …
Old Colour欧柯女装嘉兴代理商 ... TAG:EACHWAY 艺之卉杰茜 TAG:LOVE ESTEEM 爱黛 TAG:YIGUE 亦谷.
可细分为社会尊严(social esteem)和社会约束(social sanction)。社会尊严包含行为规范(no rmalit y)、做事才干(capacit y)和坚忍不拔(.

entry.tran: 受尊敬的;受敬重的;受仰慕的
entry.def: You use esteemed to describe someone who you greatly admire and respect.

example.ex: He was esteemed by his neighbours...
It is indeed an honour to serve my country in such an esteemed position.
example.tran: 在如此受人尊敬的岗位上为我的国家服务的确是一种荣誉。

auth_sentence.content: Elmer Milch was an esteemed gastrointestinal surgeon in Buffalo.

Sentence.sentence: But China is a society that has long esteemed personal financial prudence（谨慎）.

sentences.en: The art of conversation is highly esteemed in France.

sentences.en: The old teacher was much loved and esteemed.
sentences.cn: 这位老教师很受大家的爱戴。
